name: Acid Trip (itch) (Edward Atkin)
description:
Here's a game from the archives. Made in 2006.

Here's the original description (I was 14, don't judge me):

You have taken a break from gaming and have decided to take some LSD, here is the result. You are driving a rickety, badly drawn plane through your warped imagination, of wierdness, You must shoot wierd sguigles and pencils at that anger, or you may have a bad trip. Your trip may contain various extremely random shapes flashing around and slow down and speed up.

It is strongly reccomended you take regular break of 5 minutes+ every 15 minutes, or possibly more freuquently.

SIEZURE WARNING

Warning!  This game contains flashing backgrounds and other stuff, if you suffer from epilepsy or are prone to have a siezure, continue at your own risk!

If you do play it here's how:

  • Arrow keys to move
  • Space bar to shoot squiggles
  • A to shoot pencils
  • Click on the third level to fire the turrret

Also no the game isn't lagging, it just randomly sets the fixed frame rate to 10 sometimes
